meanings.definition: A photograph taken by an early photographic process employing an iodine-sensitized silvered plate and mercury vapor.
meanings.sent1: The daguerreotype captured the image of a family in black and white.
meanings.sent2: I saw a beautiful daguerreotype of a landscape in the museum.
meanings.sent3: The daguerreotype of the cat wearing sunglasses made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her smile in the daguerreotype shone brighter than the sun.
meanings.sent5: The daguerreotype revealed the details of the old city like a time machine.

meanings.definition: To take a photograph using the daguerreotype process.
meanings.sent1: She learned how to daguerreotype pictures in her photography class.
meanings.sent2: He wanted to daguerreotype the flowers blooming in the garden.
meanings.sent3: I will daguerreotype your funny face to remember this moment.
meanings.sent4: The artist's eyes daguerreotyped the beauty of the world around him.
meanings.sent5: They decided to daguerreotype the historic building before it was renovated.
